greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A002487(A006068(n)).
comment: Like in A324338, a few terms preceding each position n = 2^k seem to be a batch of nearby Fibonacci numbers in some order.
For all n > 0 A324338(n)/A324337(n) constitutes an enumeration system of all positive rationals. For all n > 0 A324338(n) + A324337(n) = A071585(n). - _Yosu Yurramendi_, Oct 22 2019
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..16384
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 0..65537
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
Index entries for sequences related to Stern's sequences
mathematica: Block[{f}, f[m_] := Module[{a = 1, b = 0, n = m}, While[n > 0, If[OddQ[n], b = a + b, a = a + b]; n = Floor[n/2]]; b]; Array[f@ Fold[BitXor, #, Quotient[#, 2^Range[BitLength[#] - 1]]] &, 106, 0]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Dec 14 2019, after _Jean-François Alcover_ at A002487 and _Jan Mangaldan_ at A006068 *)
program: A006068(n)= { my(s=1, ns); while(1, ns = n >> s; if(0==ns, break()); n = bitxor(n, ns); s <<= 1; ); return (n); } \\ From A006068
A002487(n) = { my(s=sign(n), a=1, b=0); n = abs(n); while(n>0, if(bitand(n, 1), b+=a, a+=b); n>>=1); (s*b); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 23 2019
